The post Dumbsharas appeared first on Association of Civil Engineering Students.
item.content:encoded:
Dumbsharas
Event Details: -

Event Details: –
Date: – 16th, March, 2022
Time: – 3PM onwards
Venue: – G2

Participants will have to come in a Team of 2-4 members.

Participation E-Certificates will be provided

Rules: -
  1. There has to be 2 minimum and a maximum of 4 members in a team.
  2. The performance has to be silent with no words.
  3. The player has to use facial expressions, gestures, and body language.
  4. Clues like lip-reading, humming songs, pointing to an object, and making spelling with hands are banned.
  5. Language, the number of words, and the age of the film must be said at first (only in guestures).
  6. There is a particular time limit for teams to guess the movie.
  7. Teams have to alter until every player has acted once(max 4 guests per team).
  8. Scores are recorded for every correct answer and one point if the opposite team fails to guess within the allotted time.
Download Certificates - Dumbsharas
Event Report: -

The Association of Civil Engineering Students (ACES) organized an event named “Dumbsharas”. As evident from the name, it was an offline fun event and was conducted on 16th March 2022. It had 100+ registrations. Students were appointed as disciplined in charge to maintain the decorum, and it was a successful event with the Final participation of 45 students in 12 teams. The event started at 3:30 pm and continued till 04:30 PM as per the rules of the game.

item.title: WordPress for Beginners
item.dc:creator: Sharanjit Singh
item.description:
WordPress for Beginners Seminar Details: – A two-day hands-on training workshop on “WordPress for Beginners” organized by the Association of Civil Engineering Students (ACES), Department of Civil Engineering, Guru Nanak Dev Engineering College Ludhiana, has been successfully concluded today. ACES has started a new series of Peer-to-peer learning programme, under which this event was held […]

The post WordPress for Beginners appeared first on Association of Civil Engineering Students.
item.content:encoded:
WordPress for Beginners
Seminar Details: -

A two-day hands-on training workshop on “WordPress for Beginners” organized by the Association of Civil Engineering Students (ACES), Department of Civil Engineering, Guru Nanak Dev Engineering College Ludhiana, has been successfully concluded today.

ACES has started a new series of Peer-to-peer learning programme, under which this event was held from March 03 to March 04, 2022.

It had 40 Registration along with 3  Faculty Members.

Download Certificates
Glimpse of the Workshop
Content of the Workshop

Day 1: – Installation and Intial Setup of Bitmani WordPress

      1. Installing Bitnami WordPress
      2. Seting up WordPress
      3. Installing Theme (Ocean wp)
      4. Installing Plugins
      5. Creating Pages

Day 2: – Designing the Website

      1. Editing Header & Footer menu
      2. A brief Overview of Elements
      3. Editing Home Page by adding Elements
      4. Customising the Content
      5. Converting WordPress site to Static Site
      6. Hosting wordpress site on Github pages
Outcomes of the Wordshop

The participants are well-versed with the platform (WordPress) after attending the workshop. They have become capable of exploring the world of making websites.

The post Rang de Basanti appeared first on Association of Civil Engineering Students.
item.content:encoded:
Rang de Basanti

Association of civil engineering students (ACES) organized a Fun event named “RANG DE BASANTI”. It was an online reel submission event. This event was conducted on 5th & 6th February 2022.

It had 45 registrations and 27 responses from participants.

Event Details –
It was a reel-making event. This event was categorized into 3 parts. The participant could make reels on any of the following categories –

  1. Kite making: – They can make handmade Kites with their unique ideas and send us a video or picture of them.
  2. Food Mania: – They can make food as per theme and click its pictures or make a video while making it.
  3. Dress up: – They can dress up as per theme and can add their pictures in reels.

The submissions were done via Google form.

item.title: Doorway to ACES
item.dc:creator: Sharanjit Singh
item.description:
Doorway to ACES Association of civil engineering students (ACES) organized an interactive event named “DOORWAY TO ACES”. It was conducted on 2nd February 2022. The event was conducted on Google Meet. On the first day of the event, all the participants were called to introduce themselves and share their hobbies, goals and etc so that […]

The post Doorway to ACES appeared first on Association of Civil Engineering Students.
item.content:encoded:
Doorway to ACES

Association of civil engineering students (ACES) organized an interactive event named “DOORWAY TO ACES”. It was conducted on 2nd February 2022. The event was conducted on Google Meet. On the first day of the event, all the participants were called to introduce themselves and share their hobbies, goals and etc so that it will reduce their public speaking fears. They also got a golden opportunity to interact with their respective seniors and teachers. Students found this event very helpful and useful as they got more to know about ACES and their branch. On the second day of the event interview session held where we select the active members for ACES. There were 64 online registrations with a total of 50 students participating in this event.

Below are the details of the event: –

DATE: 25th January 2022

The first-day ‘INTERACTION PROGRAMME’ was broken into 3 parts: –

●      Part 1- Interaction Programme from 11:00 AM to 11:30 AM

●      Part 2- Come to know about ACES from 11:30 AM to 12:15 PM

●      Part 3- Questioning and answering from 12:15 PM to 12:30 PM

●      Participants: – 50+

Date: 2nd February 2022

The second-day’ DOORWAY TO ACES’ held from 3:30 PM to 5:00 PM.

●      Participants: – 46

item.title: Race to Win

item.description:
Race to Win Association of civil engineering students (ACES) organized a Fun event named “RACE TO WIN”. It was a three-round event, Round 1 was conducted on 12th October 2021 and Round 2 and 3 were conducted on 13th October 2021. The event was conducted on campus grounds near Nescafe where all participants were called […]

The post Race to Win appeared first on Association of Civil Engineering Students.
item.content:encoded:
Race to Win

Association of civil engineering students (ACES) organized a Fun event named “RACE TO WIN”. It was a three-round event, Round 1 was conducted on 12th October 2021 and Round 2 and 3 were conducted on 13th October 2021. The event was conducted on campus grounds near Nescafe where all participants were called for a series of rounds involving mind-body coordination type games. There were 100 online registrations and 39 on-spot registration with a total of 139 students participating in this event.

Below are the details of the event: –

Round 1: –

The first round ‘Galaxy Racer’ was broken into 3 parts:-

  • Part 1- Bucket-ball Challenge from 3:30 PM to 4:00 PM
  • Part 2- Bowl the cup from 4:00 PM to 4:30 PM
  • Part 3- Pic a treasure from 4:32 PM to 4:42 PM

Participants: – 23 Teams

Round 2: –

The second round ‘Guess the building’ held from 3:30 PM to 4:30 PM.

Participants: – 8 Teams

Round 3: –

The third round ‘Blow the balloons’ was conducted from 4:45 PM to 4:49 PM.

Participants: – 4 Teams

3 teams were given 1st, 2nd, and 3rd positions as listed below.
